page.title: 12THE GARDEN ESTATE, ARNPRIOR
page.content: The two foresters responsible for tending the trees on Garden also operate the sawmill. Trees are trimmed using a power saw and taken to the sawmill by tractor and trailer. There the timber is cut into lengths of 5'6", 12', or 14' as required. The two main circular saws in the mill are powered by a tractor engine. Most of the timber is used on the estate - larch for fences and gates, spruce for repairs to farm buildings. Some wood is sold to timber merchants - elm for coffins, ash for tool handles, sports goods and so on. The foresters work mainly in the mill in winter and on the plantations for most of the rest of the year - planting in spring, fencing etc in summer and tree felling in autumn.
